intro: Dyschoriste setosa, commonly known as the hairy dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. Dyschoriste setosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
